meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a demon.
meanings.sent1: The dark, daemonic figure haunted the dreams of the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The eerie, daemonic presence sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent3: The daemonic laughter echoed through the abandoned house, scaring the children.
meanings.sent4: Her daemonic anger seemed to possess her, making her act irrationally.
meanings.sent5: The daemonic eyes of the painting seemed to follow you wherever you went.

meanings.definition: Possessed or influenced by a demon.
meanings.sent1: The daemonic whispers in his mind urged him to do terrible things.
meanings.sent2: She felt a daemonic force pulling her towards the forbidden ritual.
meanings.sent3: The daemonic possession of the cat made it knock over all the vases.
meanings.sent4: His daemonic behavior at the party shocked everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The daemonic voice in her head made her doubt her own sanity.

meanings.sent1: The daemonic symbols etched into the stone walls gave the room an ominous feel.
meanings.sent2: The daemonic aura surrounding the old mansion made it a place of fear.
meanings.sent3: The daemonic shadows danced in the flickering candlelight, creating eerie shapes.
meanings.sent4: The daemonic howls in the night made the townspeople fear for their safety.
meanings.sent5: The daemonic presence in the forest made it a place to avoid after dark.
